li.a: Online Resources and Programs for Learning and Fun

div.div: Thank you for your understanding and patience during this unusual time that schools are closed due to COVID19. We understand that our WSD families are managing a lot and that the safety and welfare of family is paramount. We also know that you are committed to partnering with the Woodbridge staff in supporting your child's learning. We have developed numerous options for learning activities that will support your child in review, practice, and preview of essential skills and knowledge from their school year. There will be two types of opportunities that can keep your child in the mindset for learning and ready when schools reopen.
Students will have access to online / computerized programs (Edmentum) where assignments in
English Language Arts, Math, and other content areasÂ have been assigned to them. Students can log into these
programs using their Clever Account information and any computerized device (laptop, IPad /
Tablet, Smartphone). Directions for how your child may access their Clever account are with the
tab below, "How to Login with Clever". Your child will be familiar with these programs as they are
used on a regular basis when in school.
Students will have access to instructional paper packets that are the same or similar to the online
versions of learning assignments. Students can work at their own pace and receive support from
family, teachers, and other learning friends. Students will be able to obtain these packets by
contacting their schools for the process to order and pick up instruction.
We do realize that some of our students do not have computers or internet service to access some of the resources listed. We
â€‹also know that it may be difficult to pick up instructional packets. Try not to worry if either is the case for your family. We will
do all we can to reach out to you to see how we can help our students engage in the instruction and with their teachers.Â
We encourage you to participate in the instructional activities provided but also know that these learning
opportunities will be non-evaluative during this time or upon the return to school.

br.div: Thank you for your continued support as we work to provide our students the best possible educational resources during this time of closure.
